text: it's by no means the first doping
scandal to rock athletics but it might
just be the most damaging a secret
database revealed in a German
documentary and the Sunday Times
containing hundreds of suspicious blood
tests from thousands of athletes the
files which belonged to the sport's
governing body were leaked by a
whistleblower and have been examined by
two of the world's leading anti-doping
experts their findings are damning some
results were simply grotesque in their
extremities
they were quite easily the worst I've
ever seen described as the biggest leak
of blood test data ever it's claimed
that the evidence which has been seen by
the BBC reveals widespread doping over a
decade in athletics most prestigious
events 146 medals were won by endurance
athletes with suspicious tests 55 of
them were golds
but none have been taken away by the
authorities eight hundred athletes
recorded tests that were highly
suggestive of doping or abnormal we are
concerned at these allegations and we
will refer them promptly to the
Independent Commission Russia and Kenya
are alleged to lead the way in dubious
results although officials in both
countries have dismissed the claims as a
smear campaign world governing body the
I double-a F has rejected the
investigations conclusions and defended
their anti-doping record Dan Rowan BBC
News
